data.title: Great lamb gyro
data.text: We had their lamb gyro with fries and the lamb gyro fries (spicy).  Both were excellent and only $13 for two people -- drinks included!  Nothing fancy but an outdoor picnic table and perfect weather with great food.

data.title: The best "sandwich" in Jonesbo
data.text: While there may some who question whether a gyro qualifies as a sandwich, there is no question about the quality of the food offered at Partovi's. The traditional lamb gyro is consistently outstanding. The soft, warm pita bread encases a rich array of greens, vegetables, Tzatziki sauce and incredibly well-seasoned and thinly sliced lamb. This meal stands out as both high quality and unique within Jonesboro. All of this from a food trailer in a parking lot downtown. Partovi's is a welcome addition to the culinary offerings in Jonesboro.

data.title: Best Greek Food for Miles
data.text: I developed a taste for Greek food in Europe, and I was thrilled to discover Partovi's Gyros and Falafel when I got home from visiting Greece. I'd give it more stars if I could. Perhaps they could open a Doner Kebab!?

data.title: Great gyros!
data.text: My wife and I eat here a couple of time a month. The gyros are fantastic! The owners are always friendly and appreciate your business.

data.title: Freedom to Enjoy
data.text:
The Food Truck / Stand scene in Jonesboro has, until now has been virtually non-existent except for local Bar-b-que sellers. But now we have a truly unique and excellent newcomer to set the standard for others to follow. Located in a small lot on Main Street among established bars and restaurants, "Partovi's" has become the local favorite and most enjoyable fresh and tasty spots in all of Jonesboro ! The menu is simple and inexpensive and offers up truly authentic Greek and Middle Eastern treats like their Gyro's, Falafel's, and Baklava, all made fresh and served up by the very friendly owner, his wife and their small staff of helpers. 
"Partovi's" is on my short list of local places to eat that always provide 5-Star quality food and service. So if you are local and haven't tried them or if you're in town on business, pleasure or sporting event, you owe it to yourself to enjoy this excellent food stand in Historical Downtown Jonesboro.

data.title: Excellent food!
data.text: This wonderful food trailer (it is a stand) serves some of the best food in Jonesboro.  It is authentic and the portions are large.  We stop by often to pick up food to take home.  It is never more than a five minute wait.  The meat is seasoned perfectly — whether it is chicken or beef.  I just wish they stayed open all year round!

data.title: Great food
data.text: I've been here a few times and never have been disappointed. I've tried the falafal and different gyros. Very good and fast.

data.title: Awesome!
data.text: I've eaten here multiple times and have never been disappointed, the food is very good and very fast! I usually get the lamb gyro, the idea of any meat other than beef, pork, or chicken usually would scare an American off, but it is definitely the best meat possible!

data.title: No frills just great food!
data.text: This place has been wonderful every time we stopped by after a little night life while in Jonesboro!   It's the perfect food to soak up all of those suds that Downtown Jonesboro has to offer!  I wish they had french fries, but I could make do without them.

data.title: Excellent gyros!
data.text: So this is a "food truck", ( ok actually a concession stand trailer) in downtown J'town next to BrickHouse. Awesome food!  Best gyros I have ever had anywhere.   If you like some extra kick, ask for them to make it spicy.  The only option for Greek food in Jonesboro, but you will not be disappointed.
